intro: Sinningia regina, commonly known as the royal violet, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of tubular flowers in shades of violet, purple, and white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Sinningia regina is a popular choice for indoor gardening due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
